mods.abstract: RUNAWAY. A LIBERAL reward will be paid for the detention of EMILY, a negress, aged 24 years, a fine, healthy and robust subject, about 5 feet 3 or 4 inches in height, with her child about two years and a half old, backward for his age, extremely bandy-legged, bad gums, with the loss of the right eye tooth and one front tooth ; he has the remaining marks of an eruption. She absconded on Sunday night, the 6th of May. She has been in the family of her present owner 13 years. It is presumed she was enticed away. Captains of vessels, and all other persons, are warned against harboring her. Apply at this office. m11 3t
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
